results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.

results.title: [Melbourne buildings]
results.brief_description: A compilation of short segments highlighting various Melbourne buildings. ‘Elizabeth Tower Motel’ showcasing the cantilever staircase; construction of the new ‘Allan’s Music’ building; a modern office building; Parliament House; St Vincent’s Hospital; demolition of a building on an unidentified site; footage of the intersection of Flinders and Swanston streets taken from Southbank showing the Federation Square site and surrounds before the Gas and Fuel towers were constructed and demolished; ornamental gates near St Paul’s Cathedral; ANZ Bank.

results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: Tullamarine project [original cut]
results.brief_description: A crowd waves goodbye to a T.A.A. flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.

results.title: [St Kilda Junction Overpass]
results.brief_description: Construction first began in 1970. This film explores not just the site construction but ambient shots of the surrounding traffic, footage of the W-class trams that graced the area and marvellous aerial shots of St Kilda, Albert Park and the newly constructed Dandenong Highway. (NOTE: Worksheet in HOLD file)

results.title: [Big Melbourne]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead
results.brief_description: Possible State Film Centre production. Shows a woman and her son on a journey through Melbourne’s central business district, including Flinders Street train station, St Paul’s Cathedral, shopping at Myer. Also features footage of ships and boats.

results.title: Rabbit control. Part 2: follow up
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a programme designed to control the rabbit population and their adverse effects on farming. This episode, which is narrated by Maurie Fields, looks at fumigation, destruction of habitat, baiting and shooting with follow-up procedures to ensure successful control of rabbit populations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land

results.title: Achievements in salinity control
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of salinity and its effects on irrigated agriculture. Explains the formation of the water table and the resultant salinity due to poor drainage and evaporation. Focuses on a number of strategies and research developments to combat the problem.

results.title: The Big Dry
results.brief_description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. This tape examines the effect of the drought in the Mallee region in terms of soil conservation. This area experienced severe soil erosion as farmers were forced to overgraze livestock, in particular sheep.

results.title: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks
results.creator_credit: Dept of Agriculture, Sunraysia, Horticultural Unit
results.brief_description: The establishment of large National Parks in the Mallee have as their objective, the conservation of natural resources. As part of a conservation program, projects include revegetation to support wildlife and conserve the soil and pest control of noxious species such as rabbits. With its largely semi-arid climate, the Mallee, despite suffering from land degradation due to farming and livestock practices, is another of our natural treasures.
